titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York State property records 1977.437
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-29 18:00:30 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: New York State property and estate records
did.abstract: The collection contains a deed between John Tenbruck and Peter Gallatian for a lot of land on Duke Street in New York City as well as a letter of administration for the estate of Garret Miller.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The two documents in this collection are housed in a single oversize folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New York State property and estate records, 1977.437, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a deed between John Tenbruck, of Poughkeepsie, New York, and Peter Gallatian, of New York City, for a lot of land on Duke Street in New York City. It also contains a letter of administration for the estate of Garret Miller, naming his widow the executrix and Nathanial Seeley the executor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The material in this collection is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
